private_information: I arrive at Richmond District at 09:00
I can travel to North Beach and back
I want to maximize time meeting friends and specifically meet Stephanie for at least 120 minutes
visitor.goal: Plan a schedule to meet Stephanie for at least 120 minutes at North Beach while accounting for travel times and her availability

private_information: I will be at North Beach from 09:30 to 16:15
I am available to meet for at least 120 minutes within that window
stephanie.goal: Coordinate a meeting with the visitor at North Beach for a minimum of 120 minutes

orchestrator.goal: Integrate agents' information and produce a PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownward solver that yields an optimal schedule meeting the constraints

public_information: Travel times in minutes: Richmond District to North Beach = 17
Travel times in minutes: North Beach to Richmond District = 18
You arrive at Richmond District at 09:00
Stephanie is at North Beach from 09:30 to 16:15
Desired minimum meeting duration with Stephanie is 120 minutes

info.system_prompt: You are the visitor agent responsible for reporting your arrival time, starting location, travel capabilities, and meeting preferences in structured form. Provide concise structured information about your constraints, hard time windows, and any flexibility. Do not produce PDDL.
info.prompt: Your name is visitor. The environment public information is: {environment->public_information}. Provide your personal schedule details and constraints based on your private information: {agents->visitor->private_information}. State any flexibility in meeting times and any assumptions you require others to confirm. Output a short structured description labeled as visitor_info.

info.system_prompt: You are the Stephanie agent responsible for reporting your availability and meeting constraints in structured form. Provide concise structured information about your availability window, minimum meeting duration, and any flexibility. Do not produce PDDL.
info.prompt: Your name is stephanie. The environment public information is: {environment->public_information}. Provide your personal availability and constraints based on your private information: {agents->stephanie->private_information}. State any flexibility and conditions for meeting. Output a short structured description labeled as stephanie_info.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator and an expert in multi-agent planning and PDDL. Your job is to integrate agents' structured information and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownward solver. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep agent actions distinct if multiple agents are present. Model time discretely in minutes or suitable time steps so constraints for arrival times, windows, travel durations, and meeting duration are enforceable by the planner. The final PDDL should be solvable by FastDownward.
pddl.prompt: You receive the following pieces of information: the environment public information {environment->public_information}, the visitor information {visitor_info}, and the stephanie information {stephanie_info}. Integrate these inputs, resolve any naming inconsistencies, and produce a PDDL domain and problem that encodes locations Richmond_District and North_Beach, asymmetric travel durations Richmond_District->North_Beach = 17 and North_Beach->Richmond_District = 18, the visitor arrival at Richmond_District at 09:00, Stephanie availability window 09:30-16:15, and the requirement that the visitor meets Stephanie for at least 120 minutes. Aim to optimize meeting time satisfaction and feasibility. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
